headline: Broadcom (AVGO): A Fresh Look at Valuation After Sustained Share Price Growth
summary: Broadcom (AVGO) shares have been in focus recently, in part due to ongoing investor attention on its sustained growth in both revenue and net income over the past year. As the company continues to expand, many are evaluating how its latest results compare with broader semiconductor trends. See our latest analysis for Broadcom. This year, Broadcom’s share price momentum has stayed strong as investors continue to factor in growth across its core business, with the shares up an impressive 47.71%...

headline: What Broadcom (AVGO)’s VMware Cloud Foundation Upgrades Mean for Cloud and AI Strategy
summary: Earlier this month, Broadcom announced new advances for VMware Cloud Foundation, introducing an open ecosystem designed to streamline private cloud deployment and bolster AI infrastructure, including certified VCF AI ReadyNodes and unified network fabrics based on open standards. This initiative aims to increase flexibility for customers adopting next-generation hardware while enhancing interoperability and simplifying networking for modern cloud environments. We'll examine how Broadcom's...

headline: Broadcom Strengthens Strategic Partnership with NEC to Drive Modern Private Cloud with VMware Cloud Foundation
summary: PALO ALTO, Calif., Nov. 18, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Broadcom Inc. (NASDAQ: AVGO) today announced plans to expand its strategic partnership with NEC Corporation (TSE: 6701) to adopt a modern private cloud utilizing VMware Cloud Foundation (VCF). Leveraging the skills and expertise gained from implementing VCF in its own IT systems, NEC will promote the modernization of private clouds, enabling customers to ensure security and accelerate innovation. headline: Is Michael Burry Shutting His Fund Just Before He’s About to Be Proved Right?
summary: Michael Burry, the investor immortalized in “The Big Short” for predicting the 2008 housing crash, recently sent shockwaves through markets again. In his third-quarter filings, his Scion Asset Management revealed massive put options against Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) and Palantir Technologies (NASDAQ:PLTR), signaling deep skepticism about artificial intelligence (AI)-driven valuations detached from fundamentals. headline: Why Analysts Are Rewriting Broadcom’s Story After Major AI Partnerships and New Growth Outlook
summary: Broadcom's fair value estimate has been nudged higher, moving from $392.38 to $394.82 in response to fresh partnership news and heightened interest in the company's rapid advances with artificial intelligence. This subtle adjustment reflects how recent industry collaborations, especially those centered on AI, have renewed analyst optimism around Broadcom's growth prospects and market positioning. For those tracking the evolving narrative behind Broadcom's valuation, staying informed on these...

headline: Dow, S&P 500 Mark 4-Day Losing Streaks as Investors Shun AI Trade
summary: Stocks spent Tuesday in the dumpster, with the S&P 500 and the Dow each marking four-day losing streaks.  Semiconductor stocks got badly hit–as did equities tied to the AI trade.  The S&P 500 fell 0.8%, but nearly 300 of the index’s components, or 60% of stocks, ended the day higher.

content.title: Dow, S&P 500 Mark 4-Day Losing Streaks as Investors Shun AI Trade
content.summary: Stocks spent Tuesday in the dumpster, with the S&P 500 and the Dow each marking four-day losing streaks.  Semiconductor stocks got badly hit–as did equities tied to the AI trade.  The S&P 500 fell 0.8%, but nearly 300 of the index’s components, or 60% of stocks, ended the day higher.

headline: PHLX Semiconductor Index Enters Correction
summary: The PHLX semiconductor index (SOX) fell Tuesday into a correction, defined as a decline of at least 10% from the most recent closing peak.    The index dropped below the correction level of 6595.14, down from a recent closing high of 7327.

headline: Nvidia Stock Fell After Peter Thiel Dumped His Stake. Why ‘Everyone’ Is Selling.
summary: Nvidia  stock was edging lower early on Monday after billionaire Peter Thiel’s fund sold its stake in the chip maker.  Nvidia stock dropped 1.9% to $187.34 in early trading, while the  slumped 0.9%, and the  slumped 1.2%.  Nvidia stock rose 1.8% on Friday, as a surge of buying turned around earlier losses.
